dict.string: Also known as Nitroprusside, used to reduce pressure, aortic dissection etc. dose > 4mcg/kg/min can cause cyanide toxicity within 3hrs - if a dose of 10mcg/kg/min is required for > 10min, STOP and switch to alternate agent
Titrated to effect,Multiple uses include treatment for bradycardia, anaphylaxis, hypotension, ACLS
Dose: bolus 10-20 mg then 5-15 mg/hr gtt
Better as a rate control drug but may be used for hypertension
Max is estimated at 20mcg/kg/min, but may cause hypotension. Used to improve cardiac contractility
Dose: start 10mcg/min. Up to 200 mcg/min max
titrate to effect, hold for hypotension, has rarely been associated with methemoglobinemia
Dose: Load: 0.7-1.4mg/kg then dose 1-4 mg/min infusion
Primarily cardiac rate control but with some antihypertensive effects.
antihypertensive medication, great for neuro injury etc.
Only used for life threatening bleeds
INR 2-4: 25IU/kg of factor IX to a max of 2500IU INR 4-6: 35IU/kg of factor IX to a max of 3500IU INR > 6: 50IU/kg of factor IX to a max of 5000IU - do not repeat dose - round dose up to next 500IU
central acting sleep inducer to Stage 1 sleep, no respiratory effects. Load: 1mcg/kg over 10min (not needed when transitioning from another sedative)

a. All requests for Psychiatric assessments during the hours of 0700 to 1700 need to be called directly to the Psychiatrist assigned to consultations via communications.
b. All requests for Psychiatric evaluations requested between the hours of 1700 and 0700 are to be called to Intake and Referral at ext. 2715 option 1. Please leave a message and they will be placed on the consult list.
c. Request for Psychiatrist assessments after 0900 will be performed the following business day.
historically common pressor agent, may ??? have some renal perfusion effects???? at low doses, expect some tachycardia with use
sedative with respiratory depressive effects, watch for hypertriglyceridemia after 3 days of use.
MAX of 8mg/hr to prevent propylene glycol toxicity
